zone.line: 5 Milton Areopagitica
Meanwhile other effects indirectly favorable
to the progress of mankind sprung from the same
causes. g Good & evil subsist in so intimate
few situations of human affairs
an union that no consequences can be affirmed
to contain either on of these principles in an
unconnected state. Any action or series

line.del: of actions is to be pronounced beneficial
or the contrary when the result after a
comparison of the good & evil they it contains

zone.line: the result which remains shall be ascertained

line.del: & estimated. This process is eminently difficult.

zone.line: XX which
The dominion of Rome u had usurped over the
civilized world was essentially unjust iniquitous.
It was procured by a series of aggressions, &
preserved by sanguinary despotism.

Rome
when it lost the character & priviledges of a
nation. It was inseperably incorporated with the
